授業方法: *The schedule listed below is indicative. The format, schedule, and content of graded assignments and classes, as well as the number of assignments, may change during the semester, depending on student needs.This seminar style class will conducted face to face. However, assignments/ homework, lesson resources and important class information will be provided on Google Classroom. As such, students will need access to a computer at home. BYOD for class- computer, tablet, or smartphone. Notebooks will also be required. Students will engage in active learning: working individually, in pairs, groups and as a whole class to discuss and examine global issues, develop cross-cultural awareness, and improve academic and language skills. Active participation and use of English in class is essential for passing.

トピック.授業外学習2:
Outside of class:
- For all class periods you will be required to complete homework assignments. This may include reading/listening/shadowing (i.e. graded readers or supplementary articles), vocabulary study, textbook assignments, listening assignments, writing (journal responses and presentation templates/ scripts), and oral presentation preparation. Be sure to attempt all these assignments as they reinforce language, skills and assess knowledge of content covered in class.
- Self study and independent study skills development is a large component of this course.
- Review each lesson, and check any new content, language or skills learned.
- Access any online material required. Some assignments may involve online research.
- You should expect to spend about 1~2 hours doing homework per class period.
- Do not hesitate to contact me if you need any help, I'm happy to speak to you.

教科書/Required texts1: Pathways Listening, Speaking, and Critical Thinking 3 with the Spark Platform 3rd ed.
学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
https://kwic.kwansei.ac.jp/cabinet/reference?typeCd=0&cabinetId=557&directLink=1

備考Note0: Intensive English: Students who are absent 6 times or are late 10 times automatically fail. 30 minutes late or more constitutes an absence. Two late arrivals result in one unexcused absence.
